title: preview
text:
preview(ast, max_depth=999, compact=False, as_string=False)
Print a friendly representation of a griffe object (e.g.Â function, docstring)


>>> from quartodoc import get_object
>>> obj = get_object("quartodoc", "get_object")
>>> preview(obj.docstring.parsed)
...
>>> preview(obj)
...

title: preview
text:
>>> from quartodoc import get_object
>>> obj = get_object("quartodoc", "get_object")
>>> preview(obj.docstring.parsed)
...
>>> preview(obj)
...

title: get_object
text:
get_object(
    path,
    object_name=None,
    parser='numpy',
    load_aliases=True,
    dynamic=False,
    loader=None,
)
Fetch a griffe object.











Name
Type
Description
Default




path
str
An import path to the object. This should have the form path.to.module:object. For example, quartodoc:get_object or quartodoc:MdRenderer.render.
required


object_name
'str | None'
(Deprecated). A function name.
None


parser
str
A docstring parser to use.
'numpy'


load_aliases

For aliases that were imported from other modules, should we load that module?
True


dynamic

Whether to dynamically import object. Useful if docstring is not hard-coded, but was set on object by running python code.
False






preview: print a user-friendly preview of a griffe object.



>>> get_function("quartodoc", "get_function")
<Function('get_function', ...






Name
Type
Description




x
dc.Object
abc

title: 2026-01-12-pytest
text:
Note: the name of the package in this repo is pytest1, DO NOT name it only pytest it will conflight with the PyPI pytest package and cause errors.



Create a github repo, clone it down to your computer
Use copier copy gh:pyopensci/pyos-package-template . to create an empty package shell (might also mean create new env)
Delete all the non package files (only keep the bare minimum package files), delete the test folder too
test that your package installs and runs
we will do testing today




When should you write tests?
A. before you write the function implementation B. after you write the function implementation C. during implementation writing D. when you discover a bug

title: example.add_numbers
text:
example.add_numbers(a, b)
Add two numbers together and return the result.
This is an example function with a numpy style docstring. We recommend using this style for consistency and readability.





Name
Type
Description
Default




a
float
The first number to add.
required


b
float
The second number to add.
required









Name
Type
Description





float
The sum of the two numbers.






>>> add_numbers(3, 5)
8
>>> add_numbers(-2, 7)
5
